definition: to decide (in a meeting)/to resolve (i.e. pass a resolution)
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: They used electricity from a plug in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 他们议决车库插座取电。

sentences.english: Some counties have voted to with hold payments to their states.
sentences.chinese: 有些郡议决拒绝付款给它们的州政府。

sentences.english: Determination for the member right, duty and other relative matter.
sentences.chinese: 议决与会员权利义务有关之其他事项。

sentences.english: There being no further business the chairman declared the meeting closed.
sentences.chinese: 所有事项议决完毕，主席宣布会议结束。

sentences.english: She uses these survey questions to get to know her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她议决这些问卷问题来相识病患。

sentences.english: I'm trying to improve my English through chforting online in English.
sentences.chinese: 我正议决网上聊天来进步我的英语。

sentences.english: We cobbled together a proposal to put before the committee.
sentences.chinese: 我们匆匆忙忙凑了个提议呈委员会议决。

sentences.english: The Board has resolved to establish a Committee of the Board to be known as the Remuneration Committee.
sentences.chinese: 董事会已议决于董事会辖下成立一个薪酬委员会。

sentences.english: Determine important issues relevant to the rights and obligations of members of the Chamber.
sentences.chinese: 议决与会员权利义务有关之其他重大事项。

sentences.english: The day that taste trillion won.
Therefore- the electronic cigarette Austringian rain through network marketing.
sentences.chinese: 所以澳雨电子烟都是议决网络直销的。

definition: to reach an agreement/to agree upon
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
